pros: Great Benefits, pay, work/life balance, 4-day work week. Family feel to integrate employees together in friendly environment.
cons: None at this time to list

pros: 4 day work week, nice management, benefits included, lots or classes and training opportunities
cons: Some difficult people, issues build up on days off or vacations

pros: NMCS has a mission of serving people, and the board of directors are always looking for opportunities to support the staff. Staff are fully benefitted, and there is a liberal amount of leave available to the employees. The 4 day work week is a great bonus!
cons: NMCS is a non-profit and unlike the private sector wages are not extreme. The agency does all they can in this regard, and look for every opportunity to reward their staff members.

pros: Loved working with the consumers and peers
cons: The upper management is only in it for the money. They don't care about their staff.

job_title: Specialty Billing Technician in Westminster, CO
pros: Great place to work! I work with the best people and that makes all of the difference. The company also looks out for it's employees by giving raises generally on a yearly basis, usually a week paid vacation during Christmas on top of the PTO that you accumulate. Management is very approachable and helpful. Like I said, a great place to work!!
cons: Medical is Kaiser which is good but the out of pocket until you reach the deductible could be better. Doctors appointments are usually $15 but if you need an MRI or xrays then it's out of pocket. Kaiser will work with you on the cost and will set up payment plans though.

pros: 4 day work weeks, Great PTO benefits, Paid Health benefits
cons: Because they're a non-profit, the pay is not comparable to other positions

job_title: Customer Support Advisor in Ottawa, ON
pros: Great work hours and flexible.
cons: Difficult to approach management for feedback.

pros: Great benefits 401 k match incentive
cons: Can't think of any right now

pros: Build your own schedule is a big plus
cons: Sometimes clients families forget qe have families of our own and we may want to work less at certain tof year. year.

pros: Great Work/Life Balance, Pay, and Benefits. Management really follows their Mission Statement throughout the company and Community.
cons: No downside to list for the company.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Westminster, CO
pros:
Great place to learn about yourself and how to manage others.
Benefits are good and education possibilities are abundant.
cons: You need to enjoy networking to advance.

job_title: Home Care Giver in Westminster, CO
pros: Great benefits inclusion, room for growth
cons: Pay more per hour please

pros: The job can be rewarding and fun at times. Generally, the staff is a positive group of people and the individuals that you serve are great.
cons: The pay is not great but that is to be expected in this field.

review_title: Don't work here if you want to be happy.
pros:
The pros would be a four day work week and a bright and knowledgable director, who unfortunately talked smack about her employees with other employees.  Really bad form.
The CEO is decent, but probably unaware of the unhappiness that abounds throughout the company.  No one would dare tell him for fear of loosing their job.  There is a small bonus of 2 or 3 hundred dollars at Christmas that while lovely, does not make up for lack of raises.
cons: When I first began working at this non-profit agency offering case management to adults with developmental disabilities, the benefits were fairly good.  Each year, they grew less and less.  Less days off, less or no raise and more expensive medical insurance (meaning a  large deductible for the worker).  Yes we did get full coverage, but if you needed say, and MRI, you were going to pay for it, as the deductible was thousand of dollars a year.  Many dysfunctional people working at this company and the management seemed to have no education or know how in the area of managing people.  Lunch was to be a 30 minute break, not nearly long enough.  Managers and co-workers will be happy to throw you under the bus if it means saving their own butt.

job_title: Lead Direct Care Staff in Westminster, CO
pros: You get to directly improve people's lives and the company does a great job of helping the people with disabilities get custom care. Decent benfits for staff.
cons: There is not very much support for staff. If something goes wrong staff is automatically blamed and investigated for abuse without considering the situation. That combined with such low pay its no wonder why they have such a high turnover rate.

pros: Work with great people. The company pays for your health care fully, paid time off, birthday pay, 401k
cons: Can be a little difficult to move up and company wide raises instead of individual raises based on performance.

pros: great hours, work with great people, Day program staff are great to work with
cons: Most of the directors are just about making money, most of the residential staff are not there for the right reasons, and Everyone seems to be related to each other.

pros: 3 day weekend, 36 hour work week, working with great individuals with disabilites
cons: Team leader is horrible. They do not care about employees. No cost of living raises. Christmas bonus gets smaller every year. Upper management makes over 100k a year while employees doing the actual work don't even make 25k a year. This place is a joke.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Brighton, CO
pros: Four day work week, decent pay, great people
cons: Not enough staff, not enough time to do everything in a day

pros: Everyone there is very friendly and helpful.
cons: Not enough time in the day to get everything done.
